metadata.title: What Kind of Day Has It Been?

releases.details: Includes special features related to the final season.

notes: This episode serves as the season finale, dealing with the aftermath of a downed aircraft and a town hall meeting.
The episode ends on a cliffhanger with shots being fired.

in_universe_mythology: President Bartlet speaks of his ancestor Josiah Bartlett, a real historical figure.
The episode ties in with real events surrounding the Space Shuttle, alluding to future tragedies.
real_world_cultural_references: References to U.S. political history and the presidency.
items: Photo of the President with his family

continuity_notes: This episode indicates the psychological tension leading to future political conflicts.
Continuity with the portrayal of President Bartlet's health issues.

plot.plot_summary: The staff handles a national crisis when a stealth fighter is shot down over Iraq and the President makes critical decisions regarding a military rescue operation while dealing with the misleading press coverage. As they prepare for a town hall meeting, tensions rise, leading to a shocking conclusion when gunfire breaks out.
